C# - Intro

Created:2018-09-22  Last modified:2018-09-22

  • Introduction
  • References

  1. Introduction

    Terms: C# (C sharp), .NET, .NET Framework, Common Language Runtime

    Things need to know

    1. C# is a programming language designed by Microsoft and led by Anders Hejlsberg. It was released in 2000.
    2. C# is very like to Java in terms of syntax and runtime. Microsoft wanted C# to replace Java.
    3. C# is first compiled to MSIL (Microsoft Intermediate Language), and then use JIT (Common Language Runtime) to translate into machine code (.exe or .dll [dynamic-link library] file) and run.
    4. dotnet.exe is a tool that can run the invoke the main function in .dll file. (We cannot directly run .dll because it is a library, dotnet can help us invoke .dll)
    5. .java -> .class -> (Java Virtual Machine)
    6. Some other languages, such as C++, VB, J#, can also be compiled into MSIL, which means C#, C++, VB can be used together.
    7. .NET contains the .NET framework libraries and CLR
    8. C# file has .cs extension.

    C# language features

    1. Single inhertance, all inherited from object.
    2. Based on C++, but no pointer, only reference
    3. Like C++, and unlike Java, C# programmers must use the keyword virtual to allow methods to be overridden by subclasses
    4. A C# namespace provides the same level of code isolation as a Java package or a C++ namespace, with very similar rules and features to apackage namespacescan only be imported with the "using" function.
    5. However, unlike Java, C# supports operator overloading. Only the most commonly overloaded operators in C++ may be overloaded in C#.

    Code and run C# .NET program

    To compile C#, you may need .NET Core. To run a C# program, you need .NET Core Runtime (dntnet). (It is like Java Runtime)

    The Runtime is only avaliable for Windows and Linux
